Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: yotam f
Reviews.Content: me and my girlfriend were searching flight to rome about ages.. when we finally found this hotel online we thought its great.. after reading some review on other sight we secound thought but we decided to go on it. we didnt regret it at all! from the start when we arrived the hotel the staff was realy plesent and realy helpfull. the room was big and beauttifull and realy comftrable. the hotel is realy far from the city. BUT outside the hotel like 5 m away there is a buss stop that take u all the way to the city or the metro basicly everywhere u want to go!! we have been 8 days at this hotel and i can say it was great! i recommend this hotel to every1!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal place to stay in Rome”
Reviews.Author: MoveLikeJellyfish
Reviews.Content: I can't sing the praises of Hotel Pisana Palace more. Me and a friend took a chance on lastminute.com with a secret 4* hotel and it was completely worth it. The hotel is out of the city centre as mentioned but the bus stop is literally outside and you simply catch the 881 bus into town, takes about 20 mins (tip: you can buy a bus pass for 1 euro but no one ever checks so you can get away with not paying). We read plenty of reviews before but just to note that if you're flying into Fiumicino airport you just catch a train from the station to Ponte Galeria and from there the bus 808 which stops right outside the hotel, travel round the city is very easy on buses. Taking taxis isn't worth the price at all. The hotel was large and the reception area spacious and very modern. The rooms are almost all completely renovated, we had a room on the 6th floor (top) and the lift is incredibly slow, you can walk up/down the stairs at a slow pace and still beat the lift. Our room was pleasant and roomy enough, it was serviced daily with fresh towels and bedding. The TV is lacking in any English channels but to be honest, who wants to watch TV when in Rome? Films are available at a price of 10 euros and there isn't a wide choice but this didn't bother us. Toiletries were available on request if you had forgotten anything and complimentary shower gel/shampoo/soap and shower caps were in the bathroom and replenished daily. Breakfast was buffet style with cakes, pastries, cereal, yoghurt, ham, cheese, bread, eggs, bacon. It generally doesn't get re-stocked once gone so best to get down there early if you want a wide choice. We did also have a club sandwich one evening when we had already had a full dinner at lunch and this was very enjoyable. You don't see many other guests other than at breakfast as I assume most of them went out during the day like us. Reception were helpful when we asked where they'd recommend to eat (Macheroni restaurant in town, for pasta it was brilliant!) and they also kept our luggage in storage on checkout day which saved us lugging around our bags until we were going to the airport. All in all, great place to stay in Rome if you don't mind travelling on the bus. Would recommend to anyone, fantastic value for money. Tips for Rome: Tours for areas such as Colosseum/Vatican museums are great and means you can skip the sometimes incredibly long lines. However they will know you're a tourist and try to get you to pay more than needed. At the Colosseum don't pay more than 15-20 euros and Vatican 35-40 (if you're under 25/have a student card you get discounts). Open top buses are good for getting around the city, hop on/hop off. 25 euros for 48hrs was well worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel - Modern, Comfortable and Clean! (miles out though)”
Reviews.Author: RREdinburgh
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked Hotel Pisana Palace almost by accident...we went for a cheap deal on lastminute.com - a 'secret hotel' deal. It said that "this offer is so good that the hotel chain don't want to advertise that they are giving such a low price". We knew this was a risk but the price (£184 for 4 nights) and the location 'easy access to the vatican city' proved too much temptation and we plumped for the 'secret hotel' obviously ending up with the Hotel Pisana Palace … and…all in all I think we really landed on our feet! I was initially very disappointed to find out how far out of town it is (12km) but despite being inconvenient it’s not the end of the world as town is accessible. The 881 bus runs from 5.30am to 12midnight everyday and stops outside the hotel and drops off at the edge of the Centro Storico. It takes 20- 30 minutes depending on traffic, which isn't too bad, but longer if you take into account the hanging around at the bus stop waiting - there isn’t a timetable so you just have to hope you are lucky. My estimate is that they come every 15 - 20 mins during the day and less frequently at night. I would really recommend getting hold of a bus map – available at http://www.atac.roma.it/index.asp?p=18&i=14 As for the hotel itself it has been recently renovated and is very modern, and clean to the point of clinical. The interior feels minimalist and a little space age – but it is functional more than anything and although it’s not luxurious, everything is comfortable – with big beds, strong showers and well adjusted air conditioning. The staff are friendly without being fawning and speak serviceable English. The buffet breakfast had plenty of options (cereal, bread, cake, tinned fruit, yoghurt, eggs, bacon, ham, cheese) however my only complaint is that things were never refilled. If they ran out of butter that was it, it was gone. And the muesli was finished on the first day and never replaced. Small gripe. Getting to Pisana Palace from Ciampino Airport I think if you fly into Fiumicino airport it is a fairly direct route to the hotel. However we flew into Ciampino and it was a bit more complex. You could of course get a taxi, but if you have the time and not the budget for that the best way to do it seems to be: Get a Terravision bus from outside departures to Termini in central Rome (4Euros), then walk round the corner to the bus stop and get on a 64 bus (direction St Peters), this takes you through the old town, across the river then under a tunnel, you want to get off the first stop after the tunnel and at the same bus stop you get off at you can get on a 881 which will take you direct to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, good value, location not a problem”
Reviews.Author: gad_oxf
Reviews.Content: Stayed at this hotel for four nights a few weeks ago. After being messed around by the BA strikes, we ended up flying into the airport late at night, which put paid to our getting the train and bus to the hotel - no worries though as we were able to negotiate a transfer at the airport for 40 euros. The check-in desk was manned by very helpful staff (who had a good command of English) who checked us in efficiently and directed us to our room, which was immaculately decorated (must have been one of the rooms that has been refurbished recently). As far as we could tell, they are not letting rooms out in the main body of the hotel - all the occupied rooms seemed to be in the same wing - I assume this is because refurbishment is ongoing but we heard no noise and saw no sign of this. The one bugbear we had was that there was no shower curtain in the bathroom, so water went all over the floor. Aside from that, it was very tastefully decorated, very clean, and a huge room by anyone's standards. There is a large flat-screen television in the room, a huge bed (and we had a camp-bed set up also, which made for a useful place to put our bags), air conditioning. The view is of the carpark but that can't be helped. Location-wise, yes, it is out of central Rome, but the bus stop is literally directly across the road from the hotel. The buses are frequent and reliable, and relatively quick. Bus fares are one euro for a ticket with validity for 75 minutes, which is more than enough to get you in to central Rome (about 20 mins), or even changing onto another bus (64 or 40) to get to the station. The first day we walked about a quarter mile down the road to the local tobacconist to buy bus tickets, but then realised that they do in fact sell them on the bus - there is a machine at the back vending them; once bought you then need to place them in the validation machine. Another advantage is that the bus route starts just one stop down the road which means it's easy to get a seat on the bus! Once in central Rome it's easy to walk everywhere, so public transport costs are limited to a couple of euros a day. The breakfast buffet was substantial which not only featured the typical Italian breakfast of cake, yogurt, coffee etc but also German- (cold meats, cheese, bread, nutella) and English-style (bacon, eggs) breakfast. No complaints there, and the staff were very friendly. We did have a drink in the bar on our first night; this was relatively pricey but pleasant. We got the impression that as the renovation is going on, the number of people actually staying in the hotel is quite low, so you may have a hard time if you wish to meet fellow travellers in the bar. The hotel operate safety deposit boxes behind the main check-in desk. These are free to use and you are given the key to the safe to take with you, so we felt perfectly happy using this service. Our one disappointment was that there was no swimming pool (which would have been nice given the climate!). However this wasn't expected and would just have been a bonus so it doesn't affect my rating at all. All in all, a very pleasant stay for an exceptional price. Don't let the location put you off as it couldn't be easier to get in to town.

Reviews.Title: “Large comfortable room, great location”
Reviews.Author: randywood1981
Reviews.Content: Not sure why this place gets even one bad review. We stayed in one of the newer rooms, which are fantastic. The bed is large and comfortable, the room is large and comfortable as well as well appointed. The LCD Tv was great, though the movie and Wifi package was a bit pricey. The shower was one of the best I've had at a hotel. Very clean, and spacious. The buffet breakfast was very satisfying and the bar food was pretty good too, loved the pizza for 6.50 euros. The hotel is about a 15 to 20 minute ride from the major attractions. It was also very easy to reach from the airport. The buses run frequently and honestly, we never once paid to ride the bus or the train from the airport since no one checks. It is cheap to ride the bus though, only 1 euro, we just didn't have change all the time. The train from the airport is now 8 euro each way, and is a short ride and no one checked, so save your money and act like you didn't know if caught. We loved our stay in this modern hotel in a very unmodern city. It is being changed to a Holiday Inn, so prices will probably go up. Staff were very friendly and very helpful. Take public transport to get here. The shuttle is expensive, 40 euro for two, and a taxi to the airport is about 34 euro. It took literally 30 minutes to get from the airport to the hotel by train then bus. And there's no cheaper than free. There aren't many restaurants within walking distance, but the hotel does offer a free shuttle to some local restaurants, but we were so full from dinner on the way back to the hotel we never used this service.

Reviews.Title: “For this country it's a good hotel...”
Reviews.Author: IonutIasi
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days on this hotel good: very nice design inside, nice people (they don't speak englihs very well), nice room, Very nice! bad: internet is not free and is very expensive, we asked for kingsize bed and we get two separate beds with the promise that we will be moved to another room with kingsize bed (but we didn't, they forgot), condisioning not working all the time, very thin walls. We were able to hear the neighbor making live with his partner, or the cars on the street trough the glass of the windows. For a country as Italy, is a good hotel.

Reviews.Title: “fantastic and memorable”
Reviews.Author: dravs
Reviews.Content: we went in march 2009. visited all the places in rome and stayed for 1 week. it was best of my trips

Reviews.Title: “Room was basic but the breakfast was wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Beanlet
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because of the price and the location because we were only staying one night. I got it on Priceline for $80. The location is easy to find from the airport. The room was "basic" and clean. The bed was firm. We took the bus, for 1e, to Rome and had dinner at Piazza Navona and enjoyed the lighted fountains. The breakfast was very complete and good. The staff was very helpful with giving us directions and a map.

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the bad reviews, it is great!”
Reviews.Author: kmteed03
Reviews.Content: After reading so many mixed reviews we were not sure what to expect. The hotel has been renovated, so all the bad reviews are the rooms, do not apply anymore! This hotel was great! The staff was fantastic, and they all spoke english, the rooms were modern and a good size, flat screen tvs, and a beautiful bathroom, we have no complaints about this hotel. restaurant was great and the breakfast was unbelievable. This hotel is a 20 mins bus ride from the vatican, the bus stopped is right acrossed the road, take bus 881 into the city and go from there. Small shopping center 10mins walk up the road, with grocery store. Great spot!! great value! Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel outside of the city center”
Reviews.Author: Breezy82
Reviews.Content: On our Eurotrip we stayed in 5 different hotels and this was one of the best! The staff is very very helpful and the breakfast is free and wonderful! They served all different kinds of pastry's, yogurt, meats, fruit, eggs, cereal, coffee, and orange juice. The rooms were bigger than the rest we experienced in Italy (which isn't saying too much) but they are clean and nice. There is a very nice restaurant in the hotel and a bar where you can get food if the restaurant is closed. The only drawback is the bus ride to the tourist sites in Rome is about 30-40 minutes long but it's not bad. The bus only costs 1 euro (but no one ever checked bus passes so a couple of times we didn't pay at all..). We rented a car because we drove up to Florence for a couple of days but we decided it was easier to take the bus into Rome than to drive. We also saw signs in the hotel that there was a rec room on the 2nd floor with a pool table but we never made it up there to check it out!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, would recomend it to anyone.”
Reviews.Author: BJBAustralia
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at this hotel for four days and we were delighted with the standard of the room. The staff were helpful, polite and friendly. There is a bus stop right outside the door which takes you to Saint Peter's square . The hotel is far enough from Rome to be easily accessable by car and is handy for the airport. B. Beckett. Australia.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: yi_jpn
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Pisana Palace for 5 nights and all the positive reviews here are spot on so I won't go into detail about them. The newly renovated rooms were done up nicely, breakfast was plenty and services offered throughout the hotel were great. All staff were friendly and were able to honour our request for a twin room by email despite booking a double room. Very good hotel soon to be Holiday Inn Rome Pisana! Few things that may help if you're staying at this hotel: 1) Fiumicino Airport to Hotel The hotel provides shuttle service at cost of €35 for first two/three people plus 10 for additional passengers. But the frequency is not great, few in the morning and few in the evening. You can email the hotel for latest shuttle bus times, and to reserve your space. Cheaper (and more frequent) option is to take a train from the airport (Line FR1 destination Orte/Fara Sabina) to Ponte Galeria which is 3 stops away, approx 15 mins. This costs €5.50 and runs every 15mins, every 30min on Sundays. Buy the ticket from ticket desk in the airport railway station and make sure to validate it in one of the yellow machines as you enter the platforms. Get off at Ponte Galeria, walk to the main road (few metres away) and cross the road to the bus stop so that you're in direction towards a bridge. Get on bus 808 which takes you straight to the hotel in approx 20mins. One important note though - BUY THE BUS TICKET AT THE AIRPORT! You can buy it for €1 in a shop next to the ticket desks in Fiumicino airport railway station. Don't make the same mistake as us and rely on buying the ticket at Ponte Galeria (like we were told to do so by railway staff at Fiumicino). We arrived on sunday evening and there was no way of buying a ticket in the area and you can't buy on bus. In the end, we had to take a train back to Fiumicino and took a taxi to the hotel at a cost of €55. Note that if you're travelling back to the airport this way using bus and train, you will need to use a self service machine at Ponte Galeria to buy your train ticket as it is an unmanned station. This is in Italian although was just about easy enough to guess after a few attempts! 2) Food at Hotel The hotel bar serves food so that if you arrive late, you can eat there at a reasonable cost in comparison to the hotel restaurant which seemed expensive. Bar serves beer (pint/bottles) and all sorts of other drinks. Food wise, big enough pizza for one costed €6. They also have toasted sandwiches, amongst few other options. Pint of beer costs €5 - usually served with crisps and peanuts. Very good bar to chill out in after a day of tourism or travelling! 3) Safety Deposit Box Hotel website advertises that rooms come with a safety deposit box. This is NOT the case. But there are safety deposit boxes managed by the reception free of charge. 4) Bus to/from Rome Bus 881 runs from right outside the hotel (cross the road) to Vatican. From there, you can get on bus 571 which goes to Colosseo (you can't miss it)! If you need to get to a metro station, I'd recommend 881 to Vatican and then connect onto bus 982 (same stop as where 881 drops you off) to Ottaviano metro station. Hotel advises to get 881 to Cornelia metro station but reality is - 881 doesn't stop there and you can't see the station from the bus. likewise, we couldn't find the 881 bus stop from Cornelia when coming back from city centre. If you find yourself stranded in Cornelia, taxi back to hotel will cost just under €10. Hotel shop sells one day bus pass (€4) but didn't have 3 day option (€11) or 7 day option (€16) so buy them somewhere in Rome city centre. Not sure if hotel sold single tickets though. Hotel is about 20-30min (or more depending on traffic) away from centre but we already knew that from the reviews here. The hotel is very good value for money for those who don't mind a bit of travelling like us! Oh and be careful with bus times. 881 and 982 runs until about 11.30pm but others may stop running earlier. 571 from Colosseo stops at approx 7pm. Check the bus stop sign! 5) Shops Supermarket is 10 mins walk up the road, just follow the main road heading towards Rome city centre. Only open in the daytime though! There is also a pharmacy attached to the hotel although we didn't need to use it. Overall, very good hotel, recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Wrong Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bobodad
Reviews.Content: We got trapped by the previous 'wonderful' reviews. The MALE receptionists were rude and mean. They're not helpful at all. We tried to request for another hanger (we found a broken one in the closet) + a box of tissue, they told us: 'no more hanger and tissue in the hotel and I promise you're not going to get one !). Wow, what kind of promise and customer service ! In short, whatever you asked, you had to expect a 'no' from them. Road maps provided were confusing and they didn't want to explain to you. Dinners were only OK and extremely slow. We almost fell asleep at the table. Besides, the male receptionist LIED to us that all shuttles to airport were full + couldn't take us. Fortunately, on the day before departure, Maria Rita (only female receptionist) helped to accomodate us to ride w/another couple. The bad MALE receptionist should have known their shuttle could carry 4 PERSONS. He just tried to give us a bad time ! So, if you want to have a good vacation, DON'T stay in this Hotel Pisana Palace.

Reviews.Title: “definitely going back to Pisana Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Polpetta1980
Reviews.Content: I think that some of the reviews here were really harsh. I had a wonderful stay at Hotel Pisana and I will explain why. We were on a roadtrip around Italy so at the time of booking a hotel in Rome (possibly the busiest city in Italy as far as traffic is concerned) our main requirement was that it was easily accessible by car, that it had a car park and easy access to the centre via public transportation. We had looked at hundreds of websites but it’s not easy to find anything like this when travelling on a budget! The Hotel Pisana, on the other hand, fitted the bill as it’s very easy to reach from the Great Ringroad (and we didn’t even have a SATNAV!), it’s got a big free car park right in front of it (which is patrolled at night, so no worries whatsoever) and it’s got a bus stop on the opposite side of the road, and the bus goes straight into St. Peter’s or the city centre. The bus ticket is ONLY 1 € and it can be purchased directly on board...what else could you ask for?? It’s located in a residential neighbourhood which looked very OK to me, I felt quite safe really. The second requirement was obviously price. Rome as any other capital in Europe can be very expensive and often you don’t honestly get what you pay for. We managed to book on the hotel’s website and get a 5% off on the rate because we booked more than 2 nights, paying around 47 € per night for a double room. Obviously we weren’t expecting luxury for this price. It’s true that the hotel has some floors which have been renovated and some which haven’t (I guess the top floors), whereas the whole reception, bar, and restaurant area have been entirely renovated in a kind of modern funky style. Our room was on the 5th floor, and it wasn’t one of the renovated ones. The furniture was quite old, as was the bathroom, but – surprise surprise – they were both spotlessly clean. The room was cleaned thoroughly every day and we got clean towels and clean bedsheets everyday, and honestly I felt very relieved when I saw that. I couldn’t care less about the old carpet or curtains when I realized the place was really clean all over every day (we stayed for 3 nights). But what struck me the most and made me give 2 thumbs up to this hotel was breakfast. It was absolutely brilliant. You had an endless range of choice of fresh food and beverages every day: eggs, bacon, different types of bread and “pizza romana” (a special bread with sea salt and rosemary), several types of home made fresh cakes (at least 3 or 4 types every morning, all of them delicious), several types of fresh seasonal fruit (especially melon and watermelon, as it was summer), freshly squeezed orange and grapefruit juices, croissants, butter and jam, yoghurts, honey, cereals.... really, everything you could ever wish from a breakfast! And you could order espresso or cappuccino from the bar, with absolutely no extra charge (which I did everyday! their cappuccino was delicious). I honestly thought they would charge us extra euros for this amazing breakfast, but they didn’t!! It really was included in the price of the bedroom! We were so full up after breakfast that we didn’t get hungry until dinner time, which honestly saved us lots of money as Rome can be very expensive! And the staff in the bar area was most nice and helpful, I really loved having breakfast there everyday, it almost felt like being home. Also the staff at the front desk were really helpful. We asked if they would recommend us a restaurant nearby for dinner and they booked for us a table at the only restaurant they work with, which is a 5 minute drive from the hotel. Well, that was one of our best dining experiences on our holiday. I am Italian and I hate touristy places but that was an authentic local dining experience with lots of excellent food!! And very reasonably priced as well. If you really want to enjoy the real Italian food, definitely off the beaten track, make sure you pop in, it’s called Schiavi d’Abruzzo. So I must say that our stay at Hotel Pisana was definitely a highlight of our holiday and I’d be very happy to stay there again when we go back to Rome!

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel in great location!”
Reviews.Author: flocks
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed at this hotel for one night while in rome, and it was excellent! the room was new and modern, the staff were very helpful and spoke very good english and it was easy to get into the city or vatican city via public transport. the buffet breakfast was great!! we will definitely be coming back to stay here when we come back to room in a couple of weeks!!!

Reviews.Title: “A very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: irgreece
Reviews.Content: I was a bit worried when I booked this hotel because of some reviews here. We booked for a double room for 6 days in the Hotel Pisana Palace and I must say that it was the best choice that we could do. We payed almost 55€ per night and we stayed in one of the new refurbished rooms which was just amazing. Very beautiful and stylish. The size of the bedroom and the bathroom was medium and there was cleaning service every day (we had clean towels every day). The breakfast was just amazing. There are so many choices to eat and drink; it was a good start for the long walks at the city centre. There is a bus stop outside the hotel where you can take 881and go at the city centre. You can also stop at Piazza Carpegna and take 791 and go to the metro station Cornelia and from there go wherever you want. Also, 881 stops outside San Pietro. You need 30 minutes to reach the centre but we already knew that the hotel was outside the centre so there is no reason to complain. An excellent facility of the hotel is the shuttle bus which gets you at FCO. We did not book it when we went there but we booked it at the reception a day before our departure. The charge for each person is 10€ . The staff was very patient and nice to us since we were asking them so many questions every day-they were very helpful. The only negative that I have to say is the use of internet connection. There was big charge per hour and I think that a four-star hotel should provide internet for free to its clients. Apart from that we have many good and pleasant memories from the hotel. We should definitely choose it again.

Reviews.Title: “Modern and Affordable”
Reviews.Author: AM2888
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Pisana Palace for three nights and were extremely happy with the staff, service and hotel. This hotel is up to date, clean and the staff were very helpful. The three days we were there the weather was extremely hot, and the air conditioning was something to look forward to each night. The continental breakfast was more like a full meal, consisting of eggs, meat, milk, yogurt, bread, cereal etc. and kept us going until dinner. Almost all of the staff spoke English, and were helpful when we asked how to take the bus and trains, and how to get around to all the city's attractions. When we were leaving, the lady at the front desk even printed a detailed train schedule for us to follow and explained how to take the trains. (Being from North America, we were new the the whole regional train system) The only negative was that the hotel is a 20 minute bus ride to downtown Rome. It wasn't so much a hassle to take the bus, as the stop is directly across the street from the hotel, but that the metro bus stops at 11:30pm, so if you miss the only bus back, you can expect an expensive cab ride. We would definetly stay here again because what you get for the price you pay is worth it in this city.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel with a split personality and terrible service.”
Reviews.Author: chock9
Reviews.Content: In short, stay elsewhere. Rome has so many hotels that are better yet still affordable, it is surprising this one is still in business. Most reviewers say "Good for the money", or "Not so bad". Don't get suckered in!!!! (Like we did.) With 1346 other hotels to choose from in Rome, why get stuck with "not too bad." One side is upgraded with nice beds, on-demand t.v., newer baths. The other is filthy, with beds made out of stone and bus station style bathrooms with moldy grout. The front desk staff is full of smiles, but absolutely devoid of actual service. We were travelling as a couple with our 17 year old son and daughter, both from our previous marriages. We confirmed with the hotel well in advance that we would need a room with twin beds for them. We arrived before check in time, stored our luggage, and were told by the front desk that everything was in order for the two rooms requested. When we returned that night they had "given away" our rooms. It took over 30 minutes to work things out. The air conditioning malfunctioned 3 times in 3 days. Twice it was fixed, one night we slept in a 90* room with a window that would not open. Every night until 11:00 there was a bunch of young men and women outside in the parking lot with loud music, playing soccer and hanging out. The hotel is located next to... nothing. It is 4+ miles to the closest attractions in Rome, and the only way to get there from the hotel is via bus. From what we were told it takes about an hour to get to the city via public transportation. There was a bus strike going on while we were there, so we didn't get a chance to verify this. The hotel itself is located right next to an abandoned parking stucture. From the hotel toward the city on Via Pisano there is a collection of small shops for the locals to use. After 3 nights we left Rome to visit other cities, then we were coming back for two nights before leaving. We certainly would have stayed in a different place, but we had already prepaid for 2 rooms for 2 nights. Before we left, we reminded the front desk when we would be back and the rooms that we would need. We returned 2 days later to the hotel at about 8:00 p.m. Sure enough, they had given away our rooms again, but would "accomodate" us on the other side of the hotel. As you step out of the elevator you are met by the filty carpet. It is only slightly better in the room. The beds as hard as plywood with a sheet on. We went down and immediately asked to be put back over to the side which we had reserved (the only one advertised on American web sites), but were told there were no more rooms. At the same time I was told this, another clerk checked a family of 3 adults into 2 rooms on the newer side. I checked at the front desk in the morning about the costs of the different sides. The area we had been placed in was 40 euros a night, far less than the price for the newer side. Nothing was offered to us in the way of a refund for the previous night, even though we had been given rooms that cost far less than what we had paid. Good things? The breakfast is plentiful, with an assortment of very good pastries. The people at the bar, who also run the breakfast, were very helpful and did whatever they could to get what we needed. Too bad the hotel isn't run by them! Reading these complaints can't give you any idea of how frustrating our stay was. The only time we spent in the hotel was in the morning before we headed out for the day, and in the evening when we were too tired to sightsee any more! That gives, at the most, 50 hours in the 5 days we spent. Imagine in 50 hours having to spend at least 7 of them grappling with the front desk about problems THEY have created! You might expect one problem at a hotel, but not problem after problem. Especially with no effort on their part to correct the problems and make sure they didn't happen when we came back for the 2nd half of the trip, but instead made it worse! I could never recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really worth the Price”
Reviews.Author: Retroapple
Reviews.Content: I stayed here at the end of june for 4 nights. I had researched the hotel before we went and therefore knew that the hotel had been newly refurbished. Getting to the hotel was easy, two busses from Termini Station and 25 mins from Piazza Paulo. I was pleasantly surprised to be welcomed into a hotel that actually looks like the photos on their website. The rooms are of a good size and have an equally good sized bathroom. The rooms are clean with a mini bar (inexpensive in comparison to other hotel i have stayed in), kettle, internet connection via cable in room or wifi in the foyer, hairdryer and flat screen telly (if a tv is important to you). They also have a daily chamber maid service. The hotel also has adequate parking, a restaurant, bar, and a gift shop. All very reasonably priced. It's quite so you can be sure you'll get a good nights sleep. Having read the reviews that mentioned the buffet breakfast served by this hotel. I must admit that yes indeed it was a pleasure to be offered such a delicious variety of fresh food. (both hot and cold and including fruit.) The staff at this hotel are friendly, helpful and warm. Really good customer service. I would recommend this hotel to anyone who would like a comfortable stay in Rome. Indeed it is a bus ride from the centre, but I must say that we did realize this before booking. Its perfect for people with young children, older people and generally anyone who doesn't mind traveling for 25 mins before you get into town. Im very happy with our trip to Rome and the Pisana Palace hotel made our stay very, very comfortable. I would like to return to this hotel on our return trip to Rome in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully updated!”
Reviews.Author: Daniel_Sue
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights and enjoyed every minute. The rooms were very clean, loved the flat screen on the wall....would of enjoyed more english stations (but we were in Italy!!) The place had great a breackfast, we loved the selection. It was easy to catch the bus, directly out front of the hotel. It was easy to get down town the tourist area, the last stop was when we'd get off....can't beat that, less confusion when we just arrive in Rome. We took the shuttle from the Airport...make sure to look hard for the van and i'd advise call when you arrive just to make sure they know you're there. That part was not perfect but much better then paying 50 euro for a taxi ride!

Reviews.Title: “Pisana palace not as bad as reviews lead to believe !”
Reviews.Author: jennagibb3
Reviews.Content: We were a bit worried going to pisana palace from some of the reviews we had seen but were pleasantly surprised. The hotel itself is a bit old but is undergoing a massive refurbishment so the reception is all new and modern. The breakfast buffet was out of this world with everything you can imagine on offer ... the bus is right outside and takes you to the centre of Rome in 15-20 minutes, we never had to wait for it once ! When we were leaving early for a flight the reception staff made us a packed breakfast and offered us a few esspressos, so friendly !

Reviews.Title: “La Pisana has great breakfast but beware under construction till sept 2008”
Reviews.Author: puccablu
Reviews.Content: It is old, the carpet smells, but I am extremely sensitive to smells. Lots of space in our room. The hotel is going thru a major remodeling. The day we left the a/c was completely cut off, and it was horrible! They told me the remodeling should be completed by September 2008. it is taking up the hotel chain name of Holiday Inn. I have to rave about their breakfast. Anything you can immagine is there. Staff friendliness varies from person to person. I was actually born in Rome so I didn't ask for too much directions. Restaurant on premises. If you go a bit up the hill there are supermarkets and other shops. Walking will take at least 15 min. If you have a navigator you have better choices to eat. Near the Vatican and center of Rome. There is private parking in a small garage.

Reviews.Title: “Would stay here again !!!”
Reviews.Author: bobskibo
Reviews.Content: At first I was hesitant based on the reviews I have seen. But based on my experience, it was a good hotel to stay at. It was a 20 minute bus ride the center of rome (BUS 808 and 881). The breakfast was one the the better ones I had in my entire stay. The staff was helpful, the rooms was a decent sixe. I had a triple room. The rate was excellent. I even took the bus then the train from the airport. We got the 3 day ROMA pass which covers the train and bus rides. I am not sure why other people rated this hotel bad. You need to keep in mind that you get what you paid for. As for me, my family got far more than what we paid for. I would stay here again if I came back to Rome.

Reviews.Title: “hate this hotel”
Reviews.Author: annioh
Reviews.Content: This hotel was absolutly horrific. It is being renovated, so there is scaffolding everywhere. the staff was not very helpful with directions. When you walk into the hotel, there are stains all over the carpet. The rooms are tiny, the air did not work. It was a huge disappointment. Could not even think about eating there, just from the looks of the dirty carpet and gross rooms. Would never ever go there again. Signs everywhere about the "new and improved hotel coming soon" obviously from these other reviews, renovations have been going on since 2006!!! Not a big fan.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: dk_zgb
Reviews.Content: I was terrified of this hotel because of bad reviews but after I have been there I can say that hotel is not that bad at all. There are two major disadvantages, it is very far from the city center, it takes about 5-6 bus stations + 5-6 metro stations to get to the center of Rome (30-40 min. and even longer by night). On the other hand there is a bus line no. 881 that takes you directly to the Vatican city. Second major disadvantage is that hotel is really, but I mean REALLY old. It looks like it is frozen in 1970's. However it is currently being renovated. Good things about this hotel are that rooms are spacious, relatively clean, hotel has garage parking which is free (that way you can save 30-40 EUR per day if you are coming to Rome by car), the personnel is very friendly and helpful and breakfast is really excellent. Considering very low price, I can recommend this hotel to budget travelers. They advertise this hotel to have 4 stars but in my opinion it is close to 2+ or 3 stars, even by European standards. This hotels definitely isn't the Hilton but it does the job.

Reviews.Title: “Re: Worth the price”
Reviews.Author: anna314
Reviews.Content: I was scared to death of staying here because of the reviews, but was pleasantly surprised. The rooms were spacious and clean, and were quite comfortable to stay in. The staff at the front desk were quite helpful, and spoke English well. The internet is only in the lobby, and is very expensive- 4 Euro for 30 minutes! The breakfast was really good, and there was quite a selection of food. It was all high quality and fresh. The AC wasn't working while we were there, and the front-desk said it was because of the renovations. Other than that, it was far from the Termini train station- it takes 2 buses and 1 metro to get there (1 hour with waiting times). The bus doesn't go directly to the metro stop Cornelia as they say (the 881), you have to take another bus for 2 stops (the 791) in between. The buses run quite regularly, and a 1-Euro pass will last for 75 minutes on the buses and trains. The 881 bus right in front of the hotel goes directly to the Vatican City, and took less than 30 minutes. There were restaurants about a 10-minutes walk away that were really cheap and good. We got a pizza big enough for 4 people for only 10-euro. Given that they charge you 4.50 for a latte in the Vatican, this was quite a relief on our budget! There was also a huge supermarket within walking distance where you can stock up on your Nutella. :-) I would probably stay here again, if I paid what I paid last time. This hotel would probably compare to a Holiday-Inn in the US, a solid 3-star, MAYBE 3.5. The only drawbacks were the location and the internet-in-lobby thing.

Reviews.Title: “One night here was definitely more than enough”
Reviews.Author: ilovegalicia
Reviews.Content: We stayed here our last day of the trip and we wasted a tremendous amount of time with really bad directions.... We finally found the hideous green ugly hotel in the middle of NOTHING. Now, I really do mean NOTHING. We had already stayed in 2 other hotels outside of the city and they were both in walking distance of something, this was in a deserted area. The lobby was pretty and the front desk girl was friendly although we thought it was kind of funny that she kept confusing please and you're welcome. We did find a pizza place and icecream place we liked by the metro (metro is a bus ride from hotel- not walk) and the pizza guy spoke Spanish so we were set and the gelateria I can speak enough Italian. The hotel- well the room was fine. And breakfast was okay- the boyfriend complained, but I thought it was fine. When we asked where to go to eat they seemed to have some kind of set up where a local hotel would pick you up, free of charge, and I asked how much the restaurant was and she said "average, 30-45 euros a person". I think my boyfriend and I were going to faint. We passed, you can get food in the CITY at nice restaurants, all courses for 30 euros for 2! But if you're not price conscious, I bet it's pretty great. We went to this hotel because I got it for very, very cheap. Don't recommend this hotel. There are so many hotels- you can definitely find a better one

Reviews.Title: “We chose to sleep at the airport instead.”
Reviews.Author: Lisa_Ric
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel for the last two nights of our backpacking excursion through Italy. We knew that it was some distance from central Rome, but we chose it because it promised a shuttle service to Fiumicino Airport and it claimed to be 4 stars - a nice treat after staying in hostels. It was a disaster from the start. We had trekked through Italy with absolutely no difficulty using the public transportation system - until it came time to find this hotel. The front desk kept telling us to use bus #881. Unfortunately, they neglected to tell us that 881 didn't stop directly in front of the Metro. We had to walk a mile through the rain on streets with no pedestrian walks to find a stop that 881 frequented. When we got to the hotel, we discovered that the shuttle service didn't run until 7:30 in the morning. Our flight left at 8:30, so the shuttle service was useless to us. Our room was disgusting. The bathroom door did not close. The fiberglass sink had deep brownish black gouges carved into it. The toilet flushed only if we leaned all of our body weight into the flushing mechanism. The 70's looking plywood built-in furnishings had chunks and splinters knocked out. The curtains looked as if they had been chewed on. The televison died 20 minutes after it had been turned on. Worst of all, we discovered that the hotel is frequently used by European school groups on their excursions to Rome. The entire hotel was overrun with adolescents running and screaming through the hallways, in the courtyard, and in the stairwells. The front desk did not attempt to stop them until about 1 in the morning - adding a new set of screaming voices to the mix. After the first night, we chose to check out a day early. I had pre-paid for two nights, but we decided to just let the money go. We were fully prepared to sleep sitting up at the airport instead, and if it weren't for a stroke of luck, that was exactly what we would have done.

Reviews.Title: “ICKY!!!!”
Reviews.Author: travelers4PalmBeach
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 week vacation touring Europe. Our last 2 nights were to be spent in Rome at the Hotel Pisana Palace. Luckily we had stopped off in Tuscany and decided to spend an extra night there. So our last night we were in the Hotel Pisana Palace. The hotel is being refurbished, there is scaffolding all over the building, the elevator took about 10 minutes(we were on the 4th Floor) there was no A/C in our room, the shower was falling apart, the sink was dirty & cracked, and the furniture was also falling apart. It was horrible. Not the end we had hoped for......you can bet next time I'll be checking reviews and calling the hotel before staying.

Reviews.Title: “don't go there be warned”
Reviews.Author: thomascat
Reviews.Content: we had a works team building weekend away........and stayed at the Pisana Palace 4* as this was the only hotel we could get 6 rooms....at short notice what a mistake to make the hotel is pea green in colour outside....... you walk inside and you go back in time to the 70's..... reception staff were rude and unhelpfull.... rooms dirty mould on the walls flaking paint dirty & sticky surfaces , bathrooms bad shower had so much sealant round the shower tray.... and mouldy, Bar rude and tried to over charge you.. at every chance........ Brekfast horrid stale bread rolls and some cold yellow gundge they called scrambeld egg.......... and some jams and dried up cheese & ham. ........... The hotel Is a long way from rome center......there is a bus stop right out frount of hotel..... but gets very full , rather large Italians pushing ther neither regions in your face and trying to get close to you ....sunday was a nightmare trying to get a bus as everyone is going to church........get a cab it will cost you about 18 euros there is nothing nice I can say about this hotel .my tip Don't waste your money. staying in this Pit.............I would be pay a little more and stay closer in to city centre..... This hotel is not a 4* I would say a Poor 1*

Reviews.Title: “Was Okay”
Reviews.Author: oluway
Reviews.Content: The hotel room itself was spacious and great, of course you could hear people in the next room. But many hotels in Europe seem to be that way. The breakfast buffet is the BEST part of the hotel. It's a full breakfast, not continental. Many times you won't need lunch after that. By the way, the hotel room has a small fridge hidden under the counter. They didn't advertise it, so I missed it. Only found it on my last night, and I spent 7 nights. The hotel is well-located near a bus station. Bus 881 goes to the Vatican & back. The Italian conciergies do speak English, and they can help you if you need direction. It's not as far from town as many people say. It not that bad (but you can't walk). The hotel gift shop sells bus tickets. By the way, you can take a train (and then bus) from the airport. Cheaper than cabs. Call the hotel for directions before you leave home. The experience would have been excellent except for one bad experience: the cleaning woman had the habit of just making the beds, without cleaning the bathroom. New towels were placed, but that was it. The toilet was the particular thing I couldn't stand. After looking at faeces spots for 4 days, I decided I had had enough. I kept thinking everyday I returned and it was dirty, 'I'm sure she'll notice it tomorrow' (starting from the first day I noticed it). It was SO obvious. After 4 days it had become so much worse (naturally), and it was so disgusting that I had to complain to the manager. Of course the manager argued with me at first saying the lady said she cleaned it, and that it's an "old hotel". It was so annoying to have one's intelligence so insulted. Anyone knows what "number 2" looks likes in a toilet!!! Even kids!! I wish I had done it sooner. So if you notice something wrong report it early. The toilet was then miraculously cleaned every morning after that (for the remaining 2 days I stayed). If you have to report cleaning people in order for them to do a basic job they should be doing ANYWAY, then, I think something is wrong with such a hotel. And it's NOT a cheap hotel either. I paid GOOD MONEY for it. The odd thing was, there was a toilet brush in every bathroom, so there was no excuse AT ALL. I wouldn't stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Terrible Hotel (Pisana hotel at Rome) tha is the true!!!”
Reviews.Author: GroupFromCyprus
Reviews.Content: Terrible Hotel tha is the true!My program is to stay there to this hotel (i don`t know why they call that a hotel) with my group for 3 days from 15/07/2007 until 17 stay there.The Pisana Hotel was very teribble, with dirty rooms, dirty baths, dirty floors,dirty smell, the clock is stop at 1970`s everything there and more. Finally we stay only one night and io beleive is was very must.We call back to our travel agent on the next morging and we ask to change a hotel in the same day because for sure we don't day more there and the true is was very teribble hotel!! Group from Cyprus

Reviews.Title: “No Major Complaints”
Reviews.Author: Poconobuc
Reviews.Content: As the reader will see, there are quite a number of negative reviews of this hotel. I read some of them before staying there - but after I had already booked. So - I was expecting the worst. We arrived about 2 hours before check-in and there was nothing available - but I expected that, it is rare to find a hotel in Europe that will let you check in early. They were more than happy to lock our bags away while we went into the city for a few hours. The bus (#881) stops right across the street from the hotel. It is about a 25 minute ride to the end of the 881 route (Piazza Paoli) - from there the 46 or 64 busses will take you to the Centro Storico (historic center) in about another 10 minutes. When we returned our room was ready - but the air conditioning did not work. We reported it and were promptly moved to another room - actually they gave us a suite for 5 (there were 3 of us) at no extra cost. The suite didn't have a refrigerator, but that was a minor matter to us. The rooms were clean - bathroom was comfortable, shower worked fine. We found the staff to be very courteous, even friendly - which is somewhat rare in Europe. The breakfast buffet is excellent - if a bit eclectic. I have no serious complaints - and only a couple of minor points. One - the use of the internet point is too expensive - 4 Euros (about $5.20) for 1/2 hour. Given that you can get 2-3 hours at Barnes & Noble for $2.99 - I thought that was too expensive. Also, they could run the shuttle to the Airport more often. We had an early flight, so had to take a cab - which was 45 Euros (nearly $60). The only other thing I could say is that the hotel is not very close to any shops or restaurants - but again, the bus will get you there - within 2-3 stops from the hotel there are many restaurants and shops. The 881 bus drops you virtually across the street from St Peters Square, which is quite convenient.

Reviews.Title: “Niciest people but too far from ROME”
Reviews.Author: georgepaulus
Reviews.Content: The staff is the best,, incredible nice people work in this place. The hotel is good, but unless you going to stay 1 month in Rome you should be closer to the center. It is very easy to go to the center, but it takes something around 40 minutes, and in ROME you don't have time to waste. After 4 days in this Hotel we changed to D'Este Hotel next to Termini Station.

Reviews.Title: “Bad trip back to the 1970s---bad location, bad food and bad attitudes...”
Reviews.Author: FlyGuyFLA
Reviews.Content: I booked my stay at this ironically named "Palace" with low expectations and yet Pisana still managed to disappoint. ---Location, far from downtown Rome's attractions, is amidst a bunch of auto parts warehouses, not exactly the warm ambience one seeks on Italian holiday. Yes, there is a city bus, which takes in excess of 35-45 minutes into Vatican area, but absent that you are pretty much isolated civilization. ---Exterior of the hotel is a puke green, corregated fiberglass--- pretty hard to miss---or forget! Lobby has sterile, cold, small city bus terminal feeling. ---Front desk staff sitting behing smoked plexi, resembling bullet-proof glass. Extremely surly and unhelpful, every interaction was viewed as an annoyance. Deserted lobby bar with expensive drinks and disinterested barkeep. ---Room, cross between cinder-block prison cell and low rent college dorm. Windows dirty. No amenities in room. Walls are paper thin, allowing for no privacy from late night amorous neighbors or drunken early morning revelers. ---Smoking and non-smoking rooms carelessly interspersed, giving the air in the corridors and in non-smoking rooms an acrid, stale lingering air. ---No internet access in room. One common computer in lobby (shared by hundreds of guests) requires pay in advance of 10 Euros per hour! Total rip-off in a supposed "business hotel." ---No gym, pool or recreation of any kind. ---Restaurant food quality poor and relatively expensive for what is being offered. Even if you are a budget minded, frugal traveler with modest standards and expectations, avoid this place at all costs, or you will regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: slickvik69
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel! Bus is directly across street and goes into city!

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: Scotishgirl
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a trip to Rome where we spent 5 nights at the Pisana Palace Hotel, Rome. We were here during the Rome Film Festival and every hotel in Rome was completely full (I know because I tried all of them) we settled for the Pisana. From the outside it is not an attractive building at all but it was ok inside. The building, is, at a guess a 60s building. It took a bus journey from outside the hotel 15 minutes or so to get to the terminus in the centre of rome where you could walk to The Vatican. From the terminus you could catch a 64 which took you to The Collosseum. Incidentally, our experience of the bus was very good we travelled every day on it and the buses were very frequent. We got a taxi coming back. The hotel itself was ok. The rooms we had were basic but clean. We were out all day and only needed to sleep at night and shower in the morning. The breakfast was adequate and not as bad as other trip advisors experienced. The staff in the hotel were pleasant enough and helpful. I only experienced a silly moment or two with one female staff member of the reception staff who was obviously having a bad day. The Pisana Palace is rated as 4 star but I would probably rate it as 2 and a bit. I have stayed in 4 and 5 star plus hotels and there was absolutely no comparison.

Reviews.Title: “Anything but a Palace”
Reviews.Author: Island_Gen
Reviews.Content: Thank God we only stayed one night. Check in was fine; the people working at the front desk were very nice. But the hotel was a hole. We stayed here because it was relatively close to the airport, they offered shuttle service to the airport and it was cheap, but you get what you pay for. The lobby was nice enough and so was the bar and gift shop but the niceties stopped there. The rooms were small and dark and the beds were very uncomfortable and made for little people; I am only 5 foot 4 inches and my legs were hanging over the edge of the bed. At 6 foot 6 inches tall my poor fiance was miserable. The air conditioner in the hotel was broken so the rooms were sweltering. We ate dinner at the hotel because we had to get up early to catch a flight. The service was bad and the food was not much better. Would not stay here again if you paid me!

Reviews.Title: “Pass this one up!”
Reviews.Author: BurgTraveler
Reviews.Content: Seriously, for whatever reason you're staying in Rome, pass this hotel up, no matter what the price. It evidently caters to large tours...is chaotic, unclean, and run by young and unhelpful staff. Keeping the obvious difference between American/European hotel rating systems, this hotel is in noway a 3-star rating. We were happy to have only required 1 night stay before departing from Rome.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre”
Reviews.Author: Rokh
Reviews.Content: We (family of five, young children) stayed at this hotel for three nights in August 2005. Overall, I do not recommend it despite its very nice and friendly staff. 1. The hotel was advertised as a four-star but it's, in reality, a two star hotel. 2. Location-wise, it just can't be worse: not only it's way too far from attractions, as others have pointed out, you can't even find a convenience store around the hotel. I had a car but it's a headache to have to get on a car and drive 10-20 min before you can find a restaurant, for example. The neighborhood had a ghetto appearance to it, too! 3. The staff were extremely nice, friendly and helpful; alas, they're working in the wrong place! As related to this, I should point out that they stole my wallet in the Rome subway while I was on the train with my family (the only time I didn't use my car as Fontana di Trevi, I was told, can't be reached by car. It's nonsense by the way: you park your car a block away and easily walk down to the Fontana di Trevi). It took me 2-3 hours to get back to the hotel and I was sure all my credit cards would have been used to the last penny in that period of time. Fortunately, the staff helped me out tremendously by giving me quick and easy access to internet/phone so that I was able to block all the cards in time. BTW, none of the cards had been misused (I was pretty darn lucky!). While on this, may I advise you two things: 1)all they say about using "neck straps", "body wallets" etc. are ABSOLUTELY correct. Do use them as the bloody pickpockets are darn good in what they do. 2) before you take off for Europe, make sure you have all the INTERNATIONAL phone numbers of your banks, credit cards,etc written down somewhere. Most of these North American credit cards only give you 1-800 numbers, which are useless in Europe, of course. We had my wife's credit cards (she had wisely left her purse back in our room!) most of which were the same companies as mine. I mean, I had all the phone numbers available to me (as printed on the back of her credit cards) but still, they were utterly useless. You'd be surprised to know I had A LOT of trouble only for finding the phone numbers of about six American and Canadian credit card companies!

Reviews.Title: “Very good for the price”
Reviews.Author: revanslax
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there in April 2006. The staff is very courteous and the room was clean. Some people have noted that the hotel is some distance from the center. The hotel is located outside the center but there is a bus stop right outside the hotel. The bus dropped us off at the end of its run which is close to the center. A short walk from there is all the tourist sights. And then a return trip to the hotel by bus is very easy. As everyone has noted, the breakfast buffet is excellent at the hotel. Beware however of the thin walls between rooms. We could hear the neigboring room and they were not raising their voices. Maybe it was just our room which was on the fifth floor that had the thin walls. The wireless internet service that they have is not reliable and is very expensive but I have found this out at other Rome hotels also. For the price and location it is a very good value. We will definately stay there the next time we visit Rome.

Reviews.Title: “For the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently stayed at the Pisana Palace, and agree with other reviews that the location is a big down side to this hotel. The bus does indeed stop directly outside the hotel, and is very regular, but we found that it was too far to travel into Rome for an evening meal, and stayed at the hotel every night. Using the bus during the day is fine, and it is 20 mins from St Peters, with a further 20 minutes, to Teminus, at night I think it could be quite intimidating. The staff were all very friendly and couldn't do enough to help. The room was tired and had seen better days, but was clean and spacious enough. The breakfast and the evening menu were more than adequate, although the restaurant seemed to cater for groups rather than couples. Overall, for the price I have no complaints about the Pisana Palace, but would probably be inclined to spend a bit more, to get a centrally located hotel if we were to visit Rome again.

Reviews.Title: “good hotel with car and air tix from FCO”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Stayed one night prior to leaving from FCO airport the next morning which was very convenient. regular municipal bus service in front. I booked through hotels.com @ $130 (100 euro, same amount was offered as special rate to a walk-in). We were given room 501, an extra large suite. Had to drive into rome a few Km to find a restaurant. Included breakfast was fine. I would stay here again for day prior to departure but not for an extended stay in Rome (too far away)

Reviews.Title: “Be wary of the low price”
Reviews.Author: LeftCoastTravelGirl
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pisana Palace Hotel the last night of my Rome trip because it was listed as being close to the airport and the city, a good value and full of amenities for the visitor. I was very dissapointed by this property -- The floors were dirty, carpet stained, very dark and dirty interior and exterior and loud. Additionally, this was in a very sketchy part of the city and the cab ride from the airport still cost well over 40 euros. I would recommend travelers not be fooled by the advertisements or pictures for this hotel -- It's not at all as pictured. Plan to stay in the city and either take the train to the airport or splurge on the cab fare -- this hotel is definitely not worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Worldtraveler48
Reviews.Content: We had just spent 5 weeks traveling western Europe celebrating our 25th wedding anniversary and this was our last and stop before returning to Canada. The rooms had black mold growing up in the corners of the bathrooms,the sink had orange stains and the air conditioning seemed non existent. When we requested a different room they said they were full and couldn't accomidate us. I asked why they were able to advertise themselves as a 4 star hotel when it may be considered by some as a 1.5 and I was informed that in Italy they have their own rating system that has nothing to do with a world standard. The parkade had no lighting, smelled of urine and had piles of garbage scattered about. The hotel is located in a residential section of town and the bus to the Vatican was packed with commuters if you go too early (watch for perverts on the packed bus that like to grope the women) The breakfast was good as long as you arrived early before they run out of food as there were no alternate food establishments close by. Happy Travels.

Reviews.Title: “Not good, not good at all!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Avoid this hotel. The staff (except for Francesca) were rude, unhelpful and down right arrogant. Shuttle bus to the airport is advertised, but not to Ciampano airport, and they refuse to go there even if the driver if not busy. Originally given room 437 - my God, the A/C sounded like a lawn mower. This is one tired looking hotel. Walls grubby, fittings old, carpets dirty, rooms generally sad looking and the bathroom was smelly. The photos are flattering to say the least. This is a poor 2 star at best. The restaurant at the side of the restaurant is appalling. A total rip off and lousy food, and very little in the local area by way of alternative. We ate in Rome before we returned. One positive point, the breakfast. Served in the breakfast room it is more than adequate, but this is not a good hotel, not good at all.

Reviews.Title: “Very good value for money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We´ve been 3 days in Rome for our first time and hotel was what we expected for the price. Good and clean (but not new) with excellent breakfast (really) and excellent people at front desk. More than what we expected. Not as far from town as we thought (20 minutes bus) and do not think in taking the subway because it is far away. We had only one problem with this, the first day bus people made a strike and we had to pick a taxi (16 euros to Piazza Venecia). If you don´t think in staying late in town this hotel is perfect (last bus at 23 pm). Thanks to hotel people.

Reviews.Title: “Value for Money”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Good for the money but not 4 stars by UK standards. Modern hotel with reasonable facilties although the restaurant was expensive. The included Breakfast was Good. Although the location was not central the bus service (route 881) was very good and run reguarly. There was slight problem with our booking, although it was resolved and the staff were friendly. The free transfers was very useful although it was slightly confusing at the airport upon arrival.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth four stars”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After 10 days staying at nice hotels in Siena and Sorrento, this hotel on our last night was a definite downer. Poor air conditioning, mechanical noises, antiquated bathrooms, horrible decor, so-so staff, and a location in nowhere. Although we had a car to drive into Rome, the staff was less than helpful to direct us, saying take the bus but not knowing where it let you out. Would not recommend this establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent 5 nights in total at this hotel and basically chose it for its economical price. They have a free airport shuttle bus, which you have to book in advance, but the times were wrong for our flight so we caught a taxi (45€). Very quiet area, approx.25min from the centre by bus (no.881) which were frequent and cost 1€ for 75minutes on any buses. Across the road from the last stop in Plaza Paola you can get the bus to Termini Train Station. The service was good and they all spoke very good English and were generally very helpful. A taxi from the hotel to Fuimicino cost us 35€ booked by the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Don't expect too much”
Reviews.Author: JJB
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 4-ni stay at the end of June 04. A couple of points for fellow travellers: (1) free transfer to Rome FCO Airport MUST be booked in advance, notwithstanding they displayed timetables right at the front desk. They simply refused our request when we tried to make use of it on-the- spot, and the driver was actually there reading newspapers. (2) The shuttle is in fact a 7-man minivan. Try other alternatives if you are in a group and have bulky luggages. (3) Bus 881 takes you to the centre in 20 minutes. The front desk sells bus tickets, but two out of the four we bought were out of order. Other tickets we bought from tobachi worked OK. (4) Don't trust the timetable shown on 881. When we tried to head back from San Pietro at 8.50pm, no bus came until 9.35pm! It was probably an hourly service after 8.00pm. (5) At 5 euros breakfast is excellent. (6) Walls between rooms are virtually non-existent. We could hear what TV channels our neighbours were watching.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely a bad choice”
Reviews.Author: DeliaP
Reviews.Content: I must agree with another reviewer. This is definitely not a 4 star hotel, I wouldn’t give it more than 2 stars. I think the hotel was last renovated in the seventies. The ceiling had an awkward color, the installation in the bathroom was old and rusty and the air conditioning wasn’t working. Not to mention the personal, not very polite. Moreover, we couldn’t sleep very well because of the noise in the restaurant which was one floor below us. Beside that, the hotel is far, far away from everything. Even at the hotel when we asked about a map they gave us one and told us that the hotel is somewhere here, after the map ends. I was really asking myself if it’s still in Rome From the hotel until the Vatican, which is the closest tourist attraction, it took us with the morning traffic more than 45 minutes to get there. You should also know that the bus 881 which passes by the hotel hasn’t got a station at the San Pietro railway station. From Termini station you should take the bus number 64 until the station Cavaglieri and from there you will find the bus 881 which takes you to the hotel. Overall, I was extremely disappointed and I wouldn’t recommend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “Definitely not 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: To start with, this is definitely not a 4 star hotel. It is about 1/2 hour away from the center of Rome and you have to take at least 1 bus to get there. The accommodations are clean and neat, but the hotel itself is probably the most unattractive place I've ever stayed. The included breakfast was pretty good. If you want to pay 65 euro/night then this is the place to be, but know you're not getting a 4 star hotel.. it's a 2.5 at best, and out in booneyville.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel, but hard to get to”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was very satified with the hotel in itself, especially at the rate of only 55 Euros per night. However, for one unfamilar with the city and arriving late in the day, it might be a bit of a nightmare to get to. A number of descriptions that I found on the Web suggested that it was a twenty-minute walk from the Flaminia Metro station, but it took me something like three-quarters of an hour! The location map from the Expedia site is not accurate and shouldn't be relied upon for finding the hotel. The 881 bus does indeed pass the door, but the place in Rome from which it starts is quite some way from Termini station. However, the 881 does pass by the San Pietro railway station (main-line, not Metro) near the Vatican, which is served half-hourly by trains from Termini until about 22:30. If I were staying at the Pisana Palace again, I would get a train from Termini to San Pietro and catch the bus from there. n.b Bus frequency appears to be very much less that every fifteen minutes in the evening.

Reviews.Title: “Our Stay at the Pisana Palace”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just back from our trip to Rome and thoroughly enjoyed it. Our stay at the Pisana Palace - (although out of the main tourist area) - was well worth the money. We paid 79 euros per night. The room had everything and more that was required of it. Very clean and I would say average in size, certainly not small. The breakfast was a buffet service (replenished continuously) and there was more than enough to eat to fuel you for the day ahead. We found the staff helpful and courteous. There is an excellent bus service directly outside the front door of the Hotel and this runs every 15 minutes (a number 881 bus). It takes approximately 15-20 mins. to St. Peter's depending on traffic. Please note, tickets for the bus journey have to be purchased before you enter the bus. You can buy this from the Hotel at a cost of 1 euro which lasts for 75 minutes once activated or 4 euros for the full day. This can be used on the the metro and bus services. Having found our bearings and a few questions at the Information Centres, we ascertained that once we arrived near the Vatican City you waited at the relevant bus stop (usually the one the bus had dropped you off at) a number 40 or 64 bus would then take you to the main Termini. It you don't mind being out of the city centre then I would thoroughly recommend this Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We chose the Pisana Palace Hotel for a one night stay because it was described as close to the airport and offering a shuttle to the airport. Once we checked in, we found that the shuttle hours are limited. We had to take a cab to the airport and it cost us over $60. If we had known it would cost so much to get to the airport, we would have stayed in a hotel closer to the city and would have at least had a chance to enjoy the evening. (The Pisana Palace is very far from the sights of Rome.) We were kept up most of the night by the sounds of a group of young guests running through the halls, and then telephone calls coming through to us at 2:00 AM trying to reach these same young people.

HotelInfo.Name: Idea Hotel Roma San Pietro
HotelInfo.Address: Via della Pisana 374, 00163 Rome, Italy
